sourceMeaningMnemonic: You can only manage to avoid a <radical>tsunami</radical> by standing <radical>above</radical> it on a <radical>small</radical> <radical>stool</radical> if you are very <kanji>graceful</kanji>. If you aren't graceful enough the tsunami will knock you and the stool over and you'll be swept away like everyone else.
meaningInfo: Imagine being graceful enough to balance on a small stool above a raging tsunami! Sooo cool!
readingMnemonic: No matter how <kanji>graceful</kanji> you are, the still tsunami <reading>shook</reading> (<ja>しゅく</ja>) the small stool. That's where your gracefulness came in. The stool shook, but you didn't. You balanced yourself and refused to go down.
readingInfo: It doesn't matter how badly the stool shook, you stayed graceful and didn't fall!
